resources.string:
mcOptCal
 An App to calculate American and Bermudan option prices using the LSM (Least Squares Monte Carlo) method. European option prices can also be calculated using the Black Scholes formula. The option payoff function is user-definable. An android service is used to enable long running calculations to continue in the background while other activities are in the foreground.
 Note: if the parameters for the number of monte carlo simulation paths or time steps are set too large, the device responsiveness may slow down while the calculation is running.
 
 Web: http://dragongate-technologies.com
 
 BS
 Input the option parameters and calculate the value of a European option using the Black Scholes formula. 
 
 LSM
 Input the option parameters and calculate the value of an option using the Least Squares Monte-Carlo method.
 
 Option PARAMETERS
 Payoff Function:
 Eg. K-S (Put Option), S-K (Call Option) Stock Price at time t (S) * Generated by the MC Simulation * Current Stock Price (S0)
 Exercise / Strike Price (K)
 Annual Risk Free Rate (R)
 Volatility σ (V)
 Time to Expiration in Years (T)
 numPaths: The number of monte-carlo simulation paths. Too large a value may slow down the device response.
 numSteps: The number of exercise steps per year.
 
 COPY
 Copy the output window contents to the clipboard.
 
 SETTINGS
 Adjust various settings.
 numSamples: The number of paths to display on the graph. Too large a value may cause errors.
 Threshold: Objects larger than this size are cached on the SD card. The optimum value is dependent on device memory. Too large a number may cause out of memory errors.
 uiUpdateInterval: The interval between UI updates during LSM calculations.
 
 CLR
 Clear the output window.
 
 CANCEL
 Cancel a running LSM calculation.
 
 HELP
 This help menu.
